title: Print Magazine
content:
Does anyone know what typeface is used for body content in Print? Thanks for any help!

 [‹ (x) "Stormspell" Gothic-looking logo - hand drawn {Lex}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706175221/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43873 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x "Floris") Jungle World: German weekly newspaper ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706175221/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43836 "Go to next forum topic")
author: joeypfeifer

comments.content: Do you have a sample? For now, all I can do is [run a search](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706175221/http:/www.google.com/search?q=site:typophile.com%20%22print%20magazine%22) and guess. [Miss Tiffany said](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706175221/http:/www.typophile.com/node/15813): Print magazine does use a custom version of Gotham from Hoefler & Frere-Jones [links added]. F

Florian, you are a magician, a ’producteur’ of great links!

André
Haven’t had a chance to go through Florian’s links, so this info is probably already there. But in case it’s a question, they also use TEFF Lexicon extensively.

André,

no magic involved. I’ll give away two of my ‘legerdemains’:

1. As the built-in Typophile search still is useless, better make yourself a browser bookmark with the following as the address:  
`javascript:void(q=prompt('Search%20Typophile:',''));if(q)void(location.href='http://www.google.com/search?q=site:typophile.com'+'%20'+escape(q))`  
Kudos to [Grant Hutchinson](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706175221/http:/www.typophile.com/user/1011)!  
In case you don’t like Google, feel free to replace its URL with that of a competitor …

2. Tools like [TextExpander](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706175221/http:/www.smileonmymac.com/textexpander/) or [Typinator](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706175221/http:/www.ergonis.com/products/typinator/) make it dead easy to quickly insert hyperlinks.
